source_sentence: 大般若波羅蜜多經卷第三百七
translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra, Volume 3.7

source_sentence: 十七
translation: seventeen

source_sentence: 三藏法師玄奘奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial order by Xuanzang, the Tripiṭaka Master

source_sentence: 初分無相無得品第六十六之五
translation: The First Part of the Chapter on the Formlessness of Characteristics and the Absence of Attainment (66.5)

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: "Furthermore, good performance!

source_sentence: 云何菩薩摩訶薩行深般若波羅蜜多時，能於一切無相、無覺、無得、無影、無作法中，圓滿精進波羅蜜多？
translation: "How can a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practice the perfection of effort when he practices the perfection of profound wisdom in all things that have no marks, no perceptions, no attainments, no images, and no creations?

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: "Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行深般若波羅蜜多時，能以離相無漏之心而修精進。
translation: When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva practices the profound perfection of wisdom, he's able to cultivate effort with a mark-free, uncontaminated mind.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩成就勇猛身心精進，由此能入初靜慮具足住，能入第二、第三、第四靜慮具足住，依第四靜慮起無量種神通變現，乃至以手摩捫日月，自在迴轉不以為難。
translation: As a result, the bodhisattva achieves vigorous physical and mental effort, which enables him to enter the first full abode of meditation, enter the second, third, and fourth full abodes of meditation, and give rise to measureless manifestations of supernormal abilities based on the fourth concentration, so much so that he can examine the sun and moon with his hands and freely turn around without making things difficult.

source_sentence: 成就勇猛身精進故，以神通力經須臾頃，能至他方無量百千諸佛世界，復以種種上妙飲食、衣服、臥具、醫藥、香花、幡蓋、燈明、珍財、伎樂，恭敬供養、尊重讚歎諸佛世尊，由此善根果報無盡，乃至漸次證得無上正等菩提。
translation: As a result of accomplishing heroic physical effort, in a moment's time he'll be able to use his supernormal powers to travel to measureless hundreds of thousands of other buddha-worlds, and he'll also offer various kinds of excellent food, clothing, bedding, medicine, flowers, banners, lamps, treasures, and music, respectfully make offerings, and venerate and praise the world honored buddhas, which will have endless rewards for their good roots, and gradually realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 由此善根得菩提已，復為無量世間天、人、阿素洛等，以無量種上妙飲食、衣服、臥具、醫藥、香花、幡蓋、燈明、珍財、伎樂，恭敬供養、尊重讚歎。
translation: After attaining enlightenment based on these good roots, they then go on to offer measureless gods, humans, and asuras throughout the world an infinite variety of excellent foods, clothing, bedding, medicines, flowers, banners, lamps, treasures, and music, which they respect, offer, honor, and praise.

source_sentence: 由此善根般涅槃後，自設利羅及諸弟子，猶為無量世間天、人、阿素洛等，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎。
translation: After they attain parinirvāṇa with these good roots, Śākyamuni and his disciples are like measureless gods, humans, asuras, and others of the world who offer support, honor, and praise them.

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩復以神力，能至他方無量百千諸佛世界，於諸佛所聽聞正法，聞已受持終不忘失，乃至無上正等菩提。
translation: "Furthermore, with his supernormal powers, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva can go to measureless hundreds of thousands of buddha-worlds in other directions, listen to and hear the right teaching from those buddhas, and after hearing it, accept and retain it without ever forgetting it, until he reaches unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩復以神力，成熟有情、嚴淨佛土，精勤修學一切相智，一切相智得圓滿已，證得無上正等菩提，轉妙法輪度無量眾。
translation: Again, with supernormal powers, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva matures sentient beings, purifies the Buddha's land, diligently cultivates omniscience, and after perfecting omniscience, realizes unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment and turns the wonderful Dharma wheel to save measureless multitudes.

source_sentence: 如是，善現！
translation: Thus, good manifestation!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多，成就勇猛身精進故，能令精進波羅蜜多速得圓滿。
translation: Because this is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva's practice of the perfection of wisdom and accomplishment of heroic physical effort, it can cause the perfection of effort to be quickly consummated.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: "Good performance!

source_sentence: 云何菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多，成就勇猛心精進故，能令精進波羅蜜多速得圓滿？
translation: "How does the practice of the perfection of wisdom by a bodhisattva-mahāsattva accomplish the exertion of a courageous mind that will lead to the rapid consummation of the perfection of effort?

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: "Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多，成就勇猛心精進故，速能圓滿諸聖無漏道及道支所攝精進波羅蜜多，由此能令一切不善身、語、意業無容得起。
translation: Because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva cultivates the perfection of wisdom and accomplishes the diligence of a vigorous mind, he can quickly perfect the perfection of effort contained in the noble and uncontaminated paths and the factors of the path, and as a result, he can make it impossible to start all unwholesome physical, verbal, or mental actions.

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩終不取著色若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著受、想、行、識若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Thus, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva never attaches to form whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not quiescent, and isolated or not isolated, and never attaches to feeling, perception, volition, or consciousness whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not quiescent, and isolated or not isolated.

source_sentence: 「終不取著眼處若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著耳、鼻、舌、身、意處若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "He never attaches to the sense-field of the eye whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, and he doesn't attach to the sense-fields of the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著色處若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著聲、香、味、觸、法處若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never take attachment to the form realm if it's permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, nor do they take attachment to the sense, smell, taste, touch, or dharma realms if they're permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著眼界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著耳、鼻、舌、身、意界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the eye realm as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, and never attach to the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind realm as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著色界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著聲、香、味、觸、法界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "He never attaches to the form realm whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, and he doesn't attach to the sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharma realms whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著眼識界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離「終不取著眼觸若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the element of the visual consciousness as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, distant or not distant, nor attach to the ear, nose, tongue, body, or the element of consciousness as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and distant or not distant "Never attach to eye contact as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, distant or not distant, nor attach to ear, nose, tongue, body, or mental contact as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, distant or not, and distant or not distant.

source_sentence: 「終不取著眼觸為緣所生諸受若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "He never attaches to sensations that arise from visual contact as a condition, whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, distant or not distant, nor does he attach to sensations that arise from contact with the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind as a condition, whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, distant or not, and distant or not distant.

source_sentence: 「終不取著地界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著水、火、風、空、識界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never be attached to the element of earth if it's permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, nor to the elements of water, fire, air, space, and consciousness if they're permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著因緣若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著等無間緣、所緣緣、增上緣若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to causes and conditions that are permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and distant or not distant, nor do they attach to immediately antecedent conditions, antecedent conditions, or superior conditions that are permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and distant or not distant.

source_sentence: 「終不取著無明若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著行、識、名色、六處、觸、受、愛、取、有、生、老死愁歎苦憂惱若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never be attached to nescience whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, isolated or not, nor to form, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense-fields, touch, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, old age, grief, pain, sorrow, and vexation whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, isolated or not, or remote or not isolated.

source_sentence: 「終不取著有為界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著無為界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never be attached to the existent realm whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, nor to the nonexistent realm whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著欲界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著色、無色界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never be attached to the desire realm whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not, nor to the form and formless realms whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著有漏界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著無漏界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the contaminated realm as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to the uncontaminated realm as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著初靜慮若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著第二、第三、第四靜慮若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the first concentration if it's permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to the second, third, or fourth concentration if it's permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著慈無量若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著悲、喜、捨無量若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never be attached to the immeasurable compassion that's permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and distant or not distant, nor are they attached to the immeasurable pity, joy, and equanimity that's permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and distant or not distant.

source_sentence: 「終不取著空無邊處定若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著識無邊處、無所有處、非想非非想處定若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never be attached to the meditative state of the infinity of emptiness whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, nor to the meditative state of the infinity of consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, or the state of neither perception nor non-perception whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著四念住若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著四正斷、四神足、五根、五力、七等覺支、八聖道支若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the four abodes of mindfulness as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to the four ways of correctly eliminating, the four miraculous powers, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of virtual enlightenment, or the eightfold path factor as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著空解脫門若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著無相、無願解脫門若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the liberation gate of emptiness as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to the liberation gate of marklessness or wishlessness as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, tranquil or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著布施波羅蜜多若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著淨戒、安忍、精進、靜慮、般若波羅蜜多若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the perfection of generosity if it's permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to pure morality, patience, effort, meditation, the perfection of wisdom if it's permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著內空若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著外空、內外空、空空、大空、勝義空、有為空、無為空、畢竟空、無際空、散空、無變異空、本性空、自相空、共相空、一切法空、不可得空、無性空、自性空、無性自性空若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to internal emptiness whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and remote or not remote, nor do they attach to external emptiness, internal or external emptiness, emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness without limit, dispersed emptiness, emptiness without change, emptiness of original nature, emptiness of own-marks, emptiness of shared marks, emptiness of all things, inaccessible emptiness, emptiness of nature, emptiness of self-nature, emptiness of naturelessness, emptiness of self-nature, and emptiness of naturelessness if permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and remote or not remote.

source_sentence: 「終不取著真如若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著法界、法性、不虛妄性、不變異性、平等性、離生性、法定、法住、實際、虛空界、不思議界若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to true nature as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and remote or not remote, nor do they attach to the Dharma realm, Dharma nature, non-falsity, unchanging and dissimilar nature, equality, freedom from birth, legality, Dharma abiding, reality, the space realm, or the inconceivable realm as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and remote or not remote.

source_sentence: 「終不取著苦聖諦若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著集、滅、道聖諦若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the noble truth of suffering as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to the noble truths of arising, ceasing, and the path as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著八解脫若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著八勝處、九次第定、十遍處若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the eight liberations as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to the eight abodes of excellence, nine graduated concentrations, or ten universal abodes as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, tranquil or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著一切三摩地門若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著一切陀羅尼門若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to all samādhi teachings whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, and never attach to all dhāraṇī teachings whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著五眼若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著六神通若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the five eyes whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to the six supernormal powers whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著佛十力若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著四無所畏、四無礙解、十八佛不共法若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the Buddha's ten powers whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to the four fearlessnesses, the four unhindered understandings, or the 18 distinctive qualities of the Buddha whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著大慈若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著大悲、大喜、大捨若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never be attached to great kindness if it's permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not, nor to great compassion, great joy, or great equanimity if it's permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著無忘失法若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著恒住捨性若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never be attached to the state of nonforgetfulness whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not, nor to the nature of equanimity whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, tranquil or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著一切智若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著道相智、一切相智若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to omniscience whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to knowledge of the path or omniscience whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著預流果若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著一來、不還、阿羅漢果、獨覺菩提若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to the fruit of stream-winner whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to the once-returner, the nonreturner, the arhatship, or the solitary realizer's enlightenment whether permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, quiescent or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「終不取著一切菩薩摩訶薩行若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離，亦不取著諸佛無上正等菩提若常若無常、若樂若苦、若我若無我、若淨若不淨、若寂靜若不寂靜、若遠離若不遠離。
translation: "Never attach to all bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, and isolated or not, nor do they attach to the buddhas' unsurpassed correct enlightenment as permanent or impermanent, pleasant or painful, self or no-self, pure or impure, tranquil or not, tranquil or not, and isolated or not.

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩終不取著是預流者、是一來者、是不還者、是阿羅漢、是獨覺、是菩薩、是如來，亦不取著如是有情見具足故名預流者，如是有情下結薄故名一來者，如是有情下結盡故名不還者，如是有情上結盡故名阿羅漢，如是有情得獨覺道故名為獨覺，如是有情得道相智故名為菩薩，如是有情得一切相智故名為如來。
translation: "Thus, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva never attaches to being a stream-enterer, a first-comer, a nonreturner, an arhat, a solitary realizer, a bodhisattva, or a tathāgata, nor does he attach to the fact that such sentient beings are called stream-enterers because their views are complete, first-comers because the lower bonds of such sentient beings are thin, nonreturners because the lower bonds of such sentient beings are ended, arhats because the upper bonds of such sentient beings are ended, solitary realizers because such sentient beings have attained the path of solitary realizers, bodhisattvas because such sentient beings have attained knowledge of the characteristics of the path, and tathāgatas because such sentient beings have attained knowledge of all characteristics.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 所取著法及諸有情，皆無自性可取著故。
translation: "It's because the things that are attached to and the beings that are attached to have no self-nature and can be attached to.

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩成就勇猛心精進故，雖作饒益諸有情事不顧身命，而於有情都無所得；雖能圓滿所修精進波羅蜜多，而於精進波羅蜜多都無所得；雖能圓滿一切佛法，而於佛法都無所得；雖能嚴淨一切佛土，而於佛土都無所得。
translation: "Because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva accomplishes the effort of a vigorous mind, even though he does things to benefit sentient beings without concern for their lives, he obtains nothing from them; even though he perfects the perfection of effort he cultivates, he obtains nothing from the perfection of effort; even though he perfects all the Buddha-dharmas, he obtains nothing from the Buddha-dharmas; and even though he purifies all the Buddha-lands, he obtains nothing from the Buddha-lands.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩成就如是身心精進，雖能遠離一切惡法，亦能攝受一切善法而無取著。
translation: Although the bodhisattva-mahāsattva accomplishes such physical and mental exertion, he's able to part with all bad qualities and gather in all good qualities without attaching to them.

source_sentence: 無取著故，從一佛土至一佛土，從一世界至一世界，為欲饒益諸有情故，所欲示現諸神通事，皆能自在示現無礙。
translation: Because they have no attachment, they can freely manifest the various supernormal abilities that they want to manifest from one Buddha-land to another, from one world to another, for the sake of benefiting sentient beings, without obstruction.

source_sentence: 謂或示現雨眾妙花，或復示現散眾名香，或復示現作諸伎樂，或復示現震動大地，或復示現眾妙七寶莊嚴世界。
translation: That is, he might show them raining wonderful flowers, or he might show them scattering famous fragrances, or he might show them performing tricks and music, or he might show them shaking the earth, or he might show them a world adorned with many wonderful seven treasures.

source_sentence: 或復示現身放光明，盲冥眾生悉蒙開曉。
translation: Sometimes he shows himself radiating light, and blind and ignorant sentient beings are all enlightened.

source_sentence: 或復示現身出妙香，諸臭穢者皆令香潔。
translation: Another manifestation of his body produces a wonderful fragrance that cleanses smelly things.

source_sentence: 或復示現設大祠祀，於中不惱諸有情類，因斯化導無邊有情，令入正道，離斷生命，離不與取，離欲邪行，離虛誑語，離離間語，離麁惡語，離雜穢語，離貪欲，離瞋恚，離邪見。
translation: Sometimes he shows himself setting up a great shrine in which he doesn't disturb sentient beings, and because of that, he guides measureless sentient beings into the right path, away from cutting off life, away from taking what's not given, away from desiring wrong behavior, away from false speech, away from mediated speech, away from harsh speech, away from defiled speech, away from craving, away from anger, and away from wrong views.

source_sentence: 或以布施攝諸有情，或以淨戒攝諸有情，或以安忍攝諸有情，或以精進攝諸有情，或以靜慮攝諸有情，或以般若攝諸有情。
translation: They may include sentient beings by generosity, sentient beings by pure precepts, sentient beings by patience, sentient beings by effort, sentient beings by meditation, or sentient beings by prajñā.

source_sentence: 為欲饒益諸有情故，或捨財寶，或捨妻子，或捨王位，或捨支節，或捨身命。
translation: In order to benefit sentient beings, they might abandon wealth and treasure, wives, royal positions, limbs, or their lives.

source_sentence: 隨諸有情應以如是如是方便而得饒益，即以如是如是方便而饒益之。
translation: Whatever sentient beings should be benefited by such-and-such a method, that's how they'll be benefited by such-and-such a method.

source_sentence: 「如是，善現！
translation: "So it is, good man!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行深般若波羅蜜多時，由離諸相無漏心力，能於一切無相、無覺、無得、無影、無作法中，圓滿精進波羅蜜多，亦能圓滿諸餘功德。
translation: When bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas practice the perfection of effort, they're able to perfect the perfection of effort in all things that are markless, awakened, unobtainable, shadowless, and unconstructed because of the power of the uncontaminated mind that's free of marks, and they're also able to perfect the other virtues.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: "Furthermore, good performance!

source_sentence: 云何菩薩摩訶薩行深般若波羅蜜多時，能於一切無相、無覺、無得、無影、無作法中，圓滿靜慮波羅蜜多？
translation: "How can a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practice the perfection of meditation when he practices the perfection of profound wisdom, which is the perfection of concentration in all things that are without marks, without perception, without attainment, without shadow, and without created dharmas?

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: "Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行深般若波羅蜜多時，能以離相無漏之心而修靜慮。
translation: When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva practices the profound perfection of wisdom, he's able to cultivate meditation with a mind free of characteristics and contaminants.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩除如來定，於諸餘定皆能圓滿，是菩薩摩訶薩能離欲惡不善法，有尋有伺，離生喜樂，入初靜慮具足而住；尋伺寂靜，內等淨，心一趣性，無尋無伺，定生喜樂，入第二靜慮具足而住；離喜住捨，正念正知，身受樂，聖說應捨，入第三靜慮具足而住；斷樂斷苦，先喜憂沒，不苦不樂，捨念清淨，入第四靜慮具足而住。
translation: Except for the Tathāgata concentration, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva can perfect all the other concentrations, and the bodhisattva can part with desire for bad and unskillful things, with seeking and longing, part with delight, and enter the first concentration fully abiding; part with quiescence of seeking and longing, with internal equipoise and purity, with no seeking or longing, with joy and happiness arising from concentration, and enter the second concentration fully abiding; part with delight and abide in equanimity, with right mindfulness and right knowledge, experiencing pleasure in the body and the noble teaching that it should be abandoned, and enter the third concentration fully abiding; part with pleasure and stop suffering, first delighting in sorrow and despoiling, not suffering and not delighting, and having pure mindfulness of equanimity, and enter the fourth concentration fully abiding.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩以慈俱心普緣一方，乃至十方一切世間具足而住；以悲俱心普緣一方，乃至十方一切世間具足而住；以喜俱心普緣一方，乃至十方一切世間具足而住；以捨俱心普緣一方，乃至十方一切世間具足而住。
translation: With a mind attuned to both kindness and compassion, the bodhisattva fully abides in one direction ... the whole world in the ten directions; with a mind attuned to both pity and compassion, the bodhisattva fully abides in one direction ... the whole world in the ten directions; with a mind attuned to both joy and compassion, the bodhisattva fully abides in the whole world in the ten directions; and with a mind attuned to both equanimity and equanimity, the bodhisattva fully abides in the whole world in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩超諸色想，滅有對想，不思惟種種想，入無邊空，空無邊處具足而住；超一切種空無邊處，入無邊識，識無邊處具足而住；超一切種識無邊處，入無所有，無所有處具足而住；超一切種無所有處，入非想非非想處具足而住。
translation: "Thus, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva transcends perceptions of form, ceases perceptions of existence and opposition, doesn't contemplate various perceptions, and enters the boundless realm of emptiness, which is fully abiding in the boundless realm of emptiness; transcends the boundless realm of emptiness of all kinds, enters the boundless consciousness, which is fully abiding in the boundless realm of consciousness; transcends the boundless realm of consciousness of all kinds, enters the lack of existence, which is fully abiding in the lack of existence; transcends the lack of existence of all kinds, and enters the lack of perception and non-perception, which is fully abiding in the lack of existence.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩安住靜慮波羅蜜多，於八解脫能順逆入具足而住，於八勝處能順逆入具足而住，於九次第定能順逆入具足而住，於十遍處能順逆入具足而住。
translation: When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides in the perfection of meditation, he can enter and abide fully in the eight liberations, enter and abide fully in the eight abodes of excellence, enter and abide fully in the nine graduated concentrations, and enter and abide fully in the ten universal abodes.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩能入空三摩地具足而住，入無相三摩地具足而住，入無願三摩地具足而住，入無間三摩地具足而住，入如電三摩地具足而住，入聖正三摩地具足而住，入金剛喻三摩地具足而住。
translation: Such a bodhisattva-mahāsattva can enter and abide fully in the samādhi of emptiness, enter and abide fully in the samādhi of signlessness, enter and abide fully in the samādhi of wishlessness, enter and abide fully in the samādhi of instantaneity, enter and abide fully in the samādhi of lightning, enter and abide fully in the samādhi of holiness and correctness, and enter and abide fully in the samādhi of the vajra parable.

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩安住靜慮波羅蜜多，修三十七菩提分法及道相智皆令圓滿。
translation: "Thus, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides calmly in the perfection of meditation, cultivating the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment and the wisdom of the path to their consummation.

source_sentence: 用道相智攝受一切三摩地已，漸次修超淨觀地、種性地、第八地、見地、薄地、離欲地、已辦地、獨覺地，證入菩薩正性離生，既入菩薩正性離生位已，修諸地行圓滿佛地。
translation: After using the wisdom of the path to gather in all the samādhis, he gradually cultivates the stages of transcendent purity, the stage of seed nature, the eighth stage, the stage of views, the stage of thinning, the stage of freedom from desire, the stage of accomplished, and the stage of solitary realizer, realizing the bodhisattva's correct nature free of birth, and once he's entered the bodhisattva's correct nature free of birth, he cultivates the practices of the stages to perfect the buddha stage.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩雖於諸地漸次修超，而於中間不取果證，乃至未得一切相智。
translation: Although this bodhisattva-mahāsattva gradually cultivates the stages in succession, he doesn't attain fruit realization in between, even if he hasn't yet attained the cognition of all characteristics.

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩安住靜慮波羅蜜多，從一佛土至一佛土，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎諸佛世尊，於諸佛所殖眾善本，成熟有情、嚴淨佛土。
translation: "Thus, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides calmly in the perfection of meditation, goes from one Buddha-land to another, makes offerings to, honors, and praises the buddha-honored ones, and plants many good roots in the buddhas' places, ripening sentient beings and purifying the Buddha-lands.

source_sentence: 從一世界趣一世界，饒益有情身心無倦，或以布施攝諸有情，或以淨戒攝諸有情，或以安忍攝諸有情，或以精進攝諸有情，或以靜慮攝諸有情，或以般若攝諸有情，或以解脫攝諸有情，或以解脫智見攝諸有情，或教有情住預流果，或教有情住一來果，或教有情住不還果，或教有情住阿羅漢果，或教有情住獨覺菩提，或教有情安住菩薩摩訶薩位，或教有情安住無上正等菩提，隨諸有情善根勢力，善法增長種種方便令其安住。
translation: 從一世界趣一世界，饒益有情身心無倦，或以布施攝諸有情，或以淨戒攝諸有情，或以安忍攝諸有情，或以精進攝諸有情，或以靜慮攝諸有情，或以般若攝諸有情，或以解脫攝諸有情，或以解脫智見攝諸有情，或教有情住預流果，或教有情住一來果，或教有情住不還果，或教有情住阿羅漢果，或教有情住獨覺菩提，或教有情安住菩薩摩訶薩位，或教有情安住無上正等菩提，隨諸有情善根勢力，善法增長種種方便令其安住。

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩安住靜慮波羅蜜多，能引一切三摩地門，能引一切陀羅尼門，能得殊勝四無礙解，能得殊勝異熟神通。
translation: "Thus, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides in the perfection of meditation, which can lead to all the samādhi teachings, can lead to all the dhāraṇī teachings, can attain the excellent four unhindered understandings, and can attain the excellent ripening psychic abilities.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩由得殊勝異熟神通，決定不復入於母胎，決定不復受婬欲樂，決定不復攝受生乘，亦復不為生過所染。
translation: As a result of attaining extraordinary ripening supernormal powers, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva is certain never to enter his mother's womb again, is certain never to experience the pleasures of sexual desire, is certain never to take in the vehicle of birth, and is certain never to be stained by the faults of birth.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩善見善達一切法性皆如幻化。
translation: "This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who well sees and well understands that the nature of all things is illusory.

source_sentence: 雖知諸行皆如幻化，而乘悲願饒益有情。
translation: Even though they know that all conditioned things are illusory, they ride on their compassionate vow to benefit sentient beings.

source_sentence: 雖乘悲願饒益有情，而達有情及彼施設皆不可得。
translation: Even though he rides his compassionate vow to benefit sentient beings, he understands that neither sentient beings nor their designations are attainable.

source_sentence: 雖達有情及彼施設皆不可得，而能安立一切有情，令其安住不可得法，依世俗理不依勝義。
translation: Even though they understand that both sentient beings and their supports are unobtainable, they can establish all sentient beings and cause them to abide in the unobtainable Dharma, relying on conventional principles and not on the ultimate truth.

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩安住靜慮波羅蜜多，修行一切靜慮、解脫、等持、等至，乃至圓滿所求無上正等菩提，常不捨離所修靜慮波羅蜜多。
translation: "Thus, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides calmly in the perfection of meditation, cultivates all meditation, liberation, equipoise, and equipoise, and perfects the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment that he seeks, never abandoning the perfection of meditation that he cultivates.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩行道相智，方便引發一切相智，安住其中永斷一切習氣相續。
translation: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's knowledge of the path's characteristics that skillfully gives rise to the knowledge of all characteristics, and he abides in it to permanently eliminate the continuation of all habituated tendencies.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩能永斷一切習氣相續故，能正自利亦正利他。
translation: Because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva can permanently end the continuation of all habituated tendencies, he can correctly benefit himself and correctly benefit others.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩能正自利正利他故，便與一切世間天、人、阿素洛等作淨福田，堪受一切世間天、人、阿素洛等供養恭敬。
translation: Because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva can correctly benefit himself and correctly benefit others, he then makes a pure field of merit for all worldly gods, humans, asuras, and so forth, and is able to accept offerings and respect from all worldly gods, humans, and asuras.

source_sentence: 「如是，善現！
translation: "So it is, good man!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行深般若波羅蜜多時，由離諸相無漏心力，能於一切無相、無覺、無得、無影、無作法中，圓滿靜慮波羅蜜多，亦能圓滿諸餘功德。
translation: When bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas practice the perfection of profound wisdom, the power of their uncontaminated mind, which is free of characteristics, enables them to perfect the perfection of meditation in all things that are without marks, without perception, without attainment, without shadow, and without contrivance, and to perfect the other virtues as well.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: "Furthermore, good performance!

source_sentence: 云何菩薩摩訶薩行深般若波羅蜜多時，能於一切無相、無覺、無得、無影、無作法中，圓滿般若波羅蜜多？
translation: "How can a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practice the perfection of prajñāpāramitā when he practices profound prajñāpāramitā in all things that are without marks, without perception, without attainment, without shadow, and without created dharmas?

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: "Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行深般若波羅蜜多時，能以離相無漏之心而修般若，是菩薩摩訶薩不見少法實有成就。
translation: When a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices the profound perfection of wisdom, he can cultivate prajñā with a mind free of characteristics and contaminants, which is a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who doesn't see few things that are really accomplished.

source_sentence: 「謂不見色實有成就，不見受、想、行、識實有成就；不見色生，不見受、想、行、識生；不見色滅，不見受、想、行、識滅；不見色是增益門，不見受、想、行、識是增益門；不見色是損減門，不見受、想、行、識是損減門；不見色有積集，不見受、想、行、識有積集；不見色有離散，不見受、想、行、識有離散。
translation: "That is, they don't see that form is really accomplished, and they don't see that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are really accomplished; they don't see that form arises and that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness arise; they don't see that form ceases and that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness cease; they don't see that form is the gate of gain and that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are the gate of gain; they don't see that form is the gate of decrease and that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are the gate of decrease; they don't see that form accumulates and that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness accumulate; and they don't see that form is dispersed and that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are dispersed.

source_sentence: 如實觀色是虛妄、不堅實、無自在，如實觀受、想、行、識是虛妄、不堅實、無自在。
translation: He truly observes that form is false, insubstantial, and lacking in independence, and he truly observes that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are false, insubstantial, and lacking in independence.

source_sentence: 「不見眼處實有成就，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處實有成就；不見眼處生，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處生；不見眼處滅，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處滅；不見眼處是增益門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處是增益門；不見眼處是損減門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處是損減門；不見眼處有積集，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處有積集；不見眼處有離散，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處有離散。
translation: 「不見眼處實有成就，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處實有成就；不見眼處生，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處生；不見眼處滅，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處滅；不見眼處是增益門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處是增益門；不見眼處是損減門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處是損減門；不見眼處有積集，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處有積集；不見眼處有離散，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意處有離散。

source_sentence: 如實觀眼處是虛妄、不堅實、無自在，如實觀耳、鼻、舌、身、意處是虛妄、不堅實、無自在。
translation: He truly observes that the sense-field of the eye is false, insubstantial, and lacking in independence, and he truly observes that the sense-fields of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are false, insubstantial, and lacking in independence.

source_sentence: 「不見色處實有成就，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處實有成就；不見色處生，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處生；不見色處滅，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處滅；不見色處是增益門，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處是增益門；不見色處是損減門，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處是損減門；不見色處有積集，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處有積集；不見色處有離散，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處有離散。
translation: 「不見色處實有成就，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處實有成就；不見色處生，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處生；不見色處滅，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處滅；不見色處是增益門，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處是增益門；不見色處是損減門，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處是損減門；不見色處有積集，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處有積集；不見色處有離散，不見聲、香、味、觸、法處有離散。

source_sentence: 如實觀色處是虛妄、不堅實、無自在，如實觀聲、香、味、觸、法處是虛妄、不堅實、無自在。
translation: They truly observe that the sense-fields of form are false, insubstantial, and lacking in independence, and they truly observe that the sense-fields of sound, odor, taste, touch, and dharma are false, insubstantial, and lacking in independence.

source_sentence: 「不見眼界實有成就，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意界實有成就；不見眼界生，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意界生；不見眼界滅，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意界滅；不見眼界是增益門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意界是增益門；不見眼界是損減門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意界是損減門；不見眼界有積集，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意界有積集；不見眼界有離散，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意界有離散。
translation: "He doesn't see that the eye realm is really accomplished, and he doesn't see that the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind realms are really accomplished; he doesn't see that the eye realm arises and the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind realms arise; he doesn't see that the eye realm ceases and the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind realms cease; he doesn't see that the eye realm is the gate of gain and the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind realms are the gate of gain; he doesn't see that the eye realm is the gate of decrease and the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind realms are the gate of decrease; he doesn't see that the eye realm accumulates and the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind realms accumulate; and he doesn't see that the eye realm is discrete and the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind realms are discrete.

source_sentence: 如實觀眼界是虛妄、不堅實、無自在，如實觀耳、鼻、舌、身、意界是虛妄、不堅實、無自在。
translation: They truly observe that the eye realm is false, insubstantial, and lacking in sovereignty, and they truly observe that the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind realms are false, insubstantial, and lacking in sovereignty.

source_sentence: 「不見色界實有成就，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界實有成就；不見色界生，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界生；不見色界滅，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界滅；不見色界是增益門，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界是增益門；不見色界是損減門，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界是損減門；不見色界有積集，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界有積集；不見色界有離散，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界有離散。
translation: 「不見色界實有成就，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界實有成就；不見色界生，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界生；不見色界滅，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界滅；不見色界是增益門，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界是增益門；不見色界是損減門，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界是損減門；不見色界有積集，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界有積集；不見色界有離散，不見聲、香、味、觸、法界有離散。

source_sentence: 如實觀色界是虛妄、不堅實、無自在，如實觀聲、香、味、觸、法界是虛妄、不堅實、無自在。
translation: They truly observe that the form realm is false, insubstantial, and lacking in spontaneity, and they truly observe that the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms are false, insubstantial, and lacking in spontaneity.

source_sentence: 「不見眼識界實有成就，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界實有成就；不見眼識界生，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界生；不見眼識界滅，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界滅；不見眼識界是增益門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界是增益門；不見眼識界是損減門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界是損減門；不見眼識界有積集，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界有積集；不見眼識界有離散，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界有離散。
translation: 「不見眼識界實有成就，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界實有成就；不見眼識界生，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界生；不見眼識界滅，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界滅；不見眼識界是增益門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界是增益門；不見眼識界是損減門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界是損減門；不見眼識界有積集，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界有積集；不見眼識界有離散，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界有離散。

source_sentence: 如實觀眼識界是虛妄、不堅實、無自在，如實觀耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界是虛妄、不堅實、無自在。
translation: They truly observe that the element of the visual consciousness is false, insubstantial, and lacking in independence, and they truly observe that the elements of ear, nose, tongue, body, and consciousness are false, insubstantial, and lacking in independence.

source_sentence: 「不見眼觸實有成就，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸實有成就；不見眼觸生，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸生；不見眼觸滅，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸滅；不見眼觸是增益門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸是增益門；不見眼觸是損減門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸是損減門；不見眼觸有積集，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸有積集；不見眼觸有離散，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸有離散。
translation: "He doesn't see that eye contact is really accomplished, and he doesn't see that ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact are really accomplished; he doesn't see that eye contact arises and ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact arise; he doesn't see that eye contact ceases and ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact cease; he doesn't see that eye contact is the gate of gain and ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact is the gate of gain; he doesn't see that eye contact is the gate of decrease and ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact is the gate of decrease; he doesn't see that eye contact accumulates and ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact accumulates; he doesn't see that eye contact is discrete and ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact is discrete.

source_sentence: 如實觀眼觸是虛妄、不堅實、無自在，如實觀耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸是虛妄、不堅實、無自在。
translation: They truly observe that eye contact is false, insubstantial, and lacking in spontaneity, and they truly observe that ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact are false, insubstantial, and lacking in spontaneity.

source_sentence: 「不見眼觸為緣所生諸受實有成就，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受實有成就；不見眼觸為緣所生諸受生，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受生；不見眼觸為緣所生諸受滅，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受滅；不見眼觸為緣所生諸受是增益門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受是增益門；不見眼觸為緣所生諸受是損減門，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受是損減門；不見眼觸為緣所生諸受有積集，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受有積集；不見眼觸為緣所生諸受有離散，不見耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受有離散。
translation: "They don't see that the sensations that arise from eye contact as a condition are really accomplished, and they don't see that the sensations that arise from ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact as a condition are really accomplished; they don't see that the sensations that arise from eye contact as a condition are produced, and they don't see that the sensations that arise from ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact as a condition are produced; they don't see that the sensations that arise from eye contact as a condition are collected, and they don't see that the sensations that arise from ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact as a condition are collected; they don't see that the sensations that arise from eye contact as a condition are disjointed, and they don't see that the sensations that arise from ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact as a condition are disjointed.

source_sentence: 如實觀眼觸為緣所生諸受是虛妄、不堅實、無自在，如實觀耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受是虛妄、不堅實、無自在。
translation: They truly observe that the sensations that arise from visual contact as a condition are false, insubstantial, and lacking in independence, and they truly observe that the sensations that arise from contact with the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind as a condition are false, insubstantial, and lacking in independence.

source_sentence: 「不見一切有漏法實有成就，不見一切無漏法實有成就；不見一切有漏法生，不見一切無漏法生；不見一切有漏法滅，不見一切無漏法滅；不見一切有漏法是增益門，不見一切無漏法是增益門；不見一切有漏法是損減門，不見一切無漏法是損減門；不見一切有漏法有積集，不見一切無漏法有積集；不見一切有漏法有離散，不見一切無漏法有離散。
translation: "They don't see that all contaminated things are really accomplished, and they don't see that all uncontaminated things are really accomplished; they don't see that all contaminated things arise and don't see that all uncontaminated things arise; they don't see that all contaminated things cease and don't see that all uncontaminated things cease; they don't see that all contaminated things are the gate of gain and don't see that all uncontaminated things are the gate of gain; they don't see that all contaminated things are the gate of decrease and don't see that all uncontaminated things are the gate of decrease; they don't see that all contaminated things accumulate and don't see that all uncontaminated things accumulate; they don't see that all contaminated things are scattered and don't see that all uncontaminated things are scattered.

source_sentence: 如實觀一切有漏法是虛妄、不堅實、無自在，如實觀一切無漏法是虛妄、不堅實、無自在。
translation: They truly observe that all contaminated things are false, insubstantial, and lacking in self-control, and they truly observe that all uncontaminated things are false, insubstantial, and lacking in self-control.

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩如是觀時，不得色自性，不得受、想、行、識自性；不得眼處自性，不得耳、鼻、舌、身、意處自性；不得色處自性，不得聲、香、味、觸、法處自性；不得眼界自性，不得耳、鼻、舌、身、意界自性；不得色界自性，不得聲、香、味、觸、法界自性；不得眼識界自性，不得耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界自性；不得眼觸自性，不得耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸自性；不得眼觸為緣所生諸受自性，不得耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受自性；不得一切有漏法自性，不得一切無漏法自性。
translation: 「是菩薩摩訶薩如是觀時，不得色自性，不得受、想、行、識自性；不得眼處自性，不得耳、鼻、舌、身、意處自性；不得色處自性，不得聲、香、味、觸、法處自性；不得眼界自性，不得耳、鼻、舌、身、意界自性；不得色界自性，不得聲、香、味、觸、法界自性；不得眼識界自性，不得耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界自性；不得眼觸自性，不得耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸自性；不得眼觸為緣所生諸受自性，不得耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受自性；不得一切有漏法自性，不得一切無漏法自性。

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多，於一切法皆以無性而為自性深生信解。
translation: "Thus, when the bodhisattva Mahāsattva cultivates the perfection of wisdom, he deeply believes and understands that all things are self-nature because they are devoid of nature.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩於如是事生信解已，能行內空、外空、內外空、空空、大空、勝義空、有為空、無為空、畢竟空、無際空、散空、無變異空、本性空、自相空、共相空、一切法空、不可得空、無性空、自性空、無性自性空。
translation: After generating faith in such things, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva can practice internal emptiness, external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, existent emptiness, inactive emptiness, ultimate emptiness, endless emptiness, dispersed emptiness, unchanging emptiness, emptiness of original nature, emptiness of own characteristics, emptiness of shared characteristics, emptiness of all things, inaccessible emptiness, emptiness without nature, emptiness of self-nature, and emptiness of self-nature without nature.

source_sentence: 「是菩薩摩訶薩如是行時，於一切法都不執著，謂不執著色，不執著受、想、行、識；不執著眼處，不執著耳、鼻、舌、身、意處；不執著色處，不執著聲、香、味、觸、法處；不執著眼界，不執著耳、鼻、舌、身、意界；不執著色界，不執著聲、香、味、觸、法界；不執著眼識界，不執著耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界；不執著眼觸，不執著耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸；不執著眼觸為緣所生諸受，不執著耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受；不執著地界，不執著水、火、風、空、識界；不執著因緣，不執著等無間緣、所緣緣、增上緣；不執著無明，不執著行、識、名色、六處、觸、受、愛、取、有、生、老死愁歎苦憂惱；不執著布施波羅蜜多，不執著淨戒、安忍、精進、靜慮、般若波羅蜜多；不執著內空，不執著外空、內外空、空空、大空、勝義空、有為空、無為空、畢竟空、無際空、散空、無變異空、本性空、自相空、共相空、一切法空、不可得空、無性空、自性空、無性自性空；不執著真如，不執著法界、法性、不虛妄性、不變異性、平等性、離生性、法定、法住、實際、虛空界、不思議界；不執著四念住，不執著四正斷、四神足、五根、五力、七等覺支、八聖道支；不執著苦聖諦，不執著集、滅、道聖諦；不執著四靜慮，不執著四無量、四無色定；不執著八解脫，不執著八勝處、九次第定、十遍處；不執著一切三摩地門，不執著一切陀羅尼門；不執著空解脫門，不執著無相、無願解脫門；不執著五眼，不執著六神通；不執著佛十力，不執著四無所畏、四無礙解、十八佛不共法；不執著大慈，不執著大悲、大喜、大捨。
translation: 「是菩薩摩訶薩如是行時，於一切法都不執著，謂不執著色，不執著受、想、行、識；不執著眼處，不執著耳、鼻、舌、身、意處；不執著色處，不執著聲、香、味、觸、法處；不執著眼界，不執著耳、鼻、舌、身、意界；不執著色界，不執著聲、香、味、觸、法界；不執著眼識界，不執著耳、鼻、舌、身、意識界；不執著眼觸，不執著耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸；不執著眼觸為緣所生諸受，不執著耳、鼻、舌、身、意觸為緣所生諸受；不執著地界，不執著水、火、風、空、識界；不執著因緣，不執著等無間緣、所緣緣、增上緣；不執著無明，不執著行、識、名色、六處、觸、受、愛、取、有、生、老死愁歎苦憂惱；不執著布施波羅蜜多，不執著淨戒、安忍、精進、靜慮、般若波羅蜜多；不執著內空，不執著外空、內外空、空空、大空、勝義空、有為空、無為空、畢竟空、無際空、散空、無變異空、本性空、自相空、共相空、一切法空、不可得空、無性空、自性空、無性自性空；不執著真如，不執著法界、法性、不虛妄性、不變異性、平等性、離生性、法定、法住、實際、虛空界、不思議界；不執著四念住，不執著四正斷、四神足、五根、五力、七等覺支、八聖道支；不執著苦聖諦，不執著集、滅、道聖諦；不執著四靜慮，不執著四無量、四無色定；不執著八解脫，不執著八勝處、九次第定、十遍處；不執著一切三摩地門，不執著一切陀羅尼門；不執著空解脫門，不執著無相、無願解脫門；不執著五眼，不執著六神通；不執著佛十力，不執著四無所畏、四無礙解、十八佛不共法；不執著大慈，不執著大悲、大喜、大捨。

source_sentence: 大般若波羅蜜多經卷第三百七十七
translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra, Volume 3, Part 177
